SEARCH
Package smarthome

Class Simulation

java.lang.Object
smarthome.Simulation
public final class Simulation extends Object
Simulation represents the core class responsible for managing and executing the simulation of a house environment. This class controls the lifecycle of a simulation, including initializing events, managing state changes, and coordinating interactions between various components like rooms, devices, and inhabitants.

  • Field Details

    • TICS

      private final int TICS
      Represents the default number of ticks per simulation cycle.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • house

      private static House house

    • eventQueue

      private Queue<Event> eventQueue
      Represents a queue to manage and store pending events within the simulation. Events stored in this queue are instances of objects that implement the Event interface, representing various actions or occurrences within the simulation, such as device malfunctions, inhabitant activities, or pet-related events.

    • instance

      private static Simulation instance

    • random

      Random random

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static Simulation getInstance()

    • run

      public void run()
      Executes the simulation by processing events, managing inhabitants and devices, and updating room states over a series of predefined ticks. This method orchestrates the interaction among the components of the house simulation.

    • setHouse

      public void setHouse(House house)

    • getEventQueue

      public Queue<Event> getEventQueue()

    • getDevices

      public List<Device> getDevices()

    • getInhabitants

      public List<Inhabitant> getInhabitants()

    • updateRoomStats

      public void updateRoomStats(Room room)
      Updates the stats of all sensors in the specified room.
      Parameters:
      room - the room whose sensors and statistics should be updated

    • registerChains

      public void registerChains()
      Registers event handling chains for various event types in the system. A chain of Inhabitant objects is created using the inhabitants of the simulation. The chain is then registered with the EventBus to handle specific event types.

    • generateDeviceBreakdown

      public void generateDeviceBreakdown(List<Device> devices)
      Simulates the random breakdown of devices in the system. If a device breaks, a corresponding event is created, added to the event queue, and published to the EventBus.
      Parameters:
      devices - the list of devices to check for potential breakdowns

    • generateCryingBabies

      public void generateCryingBabies(List<Inhabitant> inhabitants)
      Generates crying events for baby inhabitants in the simulation. This event is added to the event queue and subsequently published to the EventBus for handling by other components of the system.

    • generatePetEvents

      public void generatePetEvents(List<Inhabitant> inhabitants)
      Generates events for pet inhabitants in the simulation. This method randomly determines whether the animal will seek attention or perform a wandering task.

    • printTicks

      public void printTicks(int tick)

    • printSeparators

      public void printSeparators()
